Intervention: Patients received a continuous daily oral dose of Afatinib 50 mg from day 1 to day 21 of each treatment. 2 treatment courses were to be given during the trial.
Patients received a continuous daily oral dose of Lapatinib 1500 mg from day 1 to day 21 of each treatment. 2 treatment courses were to be given during the trial.
Eligibility: A histologically proven breast cancer that has not received any prior treatment.
A locally advanced disease Stade IIIa with no evidence of distant metastatic disease other than lymph nodes of the anatomical site.
Absolute number of neutrophils (ANCs) less than 1500/mm3.
Number of platelets less than 100 000/ mm3.
Aspartate amino transferase (AST) or alanine amino transferase (ALT) greater than twice the upper limit of normal.
Serum creatinine is more than 1.5 times higher than the upper normal limit.
Significant or recent acute gastrointestinal disorders with diarrhoea
• System dysfunction of the organs, including the heart (EFV < 50%).
Previous treatment with trastuzumab, EGFR or EGFR/HER2-inhibitors.
Other malignancies diagnosed in the last five years.
HIV, hepatitis B or C is active.
Results: The objective response (complete or partial) was evaluated according to RECIST 1.0 criteria.
Timeline: Tumor assessments were conducted on day 22 and day 43 of screening.
In addition, patients were given a continuous daily dose of Afatinib 50 mg orally from day 1 to day 21 of each treatment course. 2 treatment courses were to be given during the trial.
Unit of measure: Percentage of participants 80.0 (44.4 to 97.5)
Title of the arm/group: Lapatinib 1500 mg
Description of the arm/group: Patients received a continuous daily oral dose of Lapatinib 1500 mg from day 1 to day 21 of each course of treatment.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 75.0 (34.9 to 96.8)
